text.headline: Human / Prophetic Timeline (anchors, periods, and overlap envelopes)
text.text: BCE years are negative. Groups separate Bible-history anchors, prophecy intervals, JW reference anchors, and explicitly non-doctrinal demographic envelopes.

text.headline: David reign → Solomon reign (overlap window)
text.text: Bible-history anchors shown as an interval window here to match your graphic’s clustered placement.

text.headline: Jerusalem destroyed (JW anchor)
text.text: Used as a prophetic framework anchor in the JW model.

text.headline: Gentile Times (JW framework)
text.text: Prophecy period shown as a fixed interval in the JW framework (start: Jerusalem destroyed; end: 1914).

text.headline: Franz lifespan (anchor interval)
text.text: Used as an overlap anchor in your non-doctrinal envelope reasoning. (Birth–death shown as an interval.)

text.headline: Overlap anchor: Franz dies (1992)
text.text: Explicitly used in non-doctrinal envelope math as a crossover anchor point.
Right-edge marker shown in your graphic.

text.headline: Reasonable envelope (non-doctrinal)
text.text: Exploratory demographic/overlap envelope. Not doctrinal; meant as a plausibility band anchored by ordinary lifespan continuity.

text.headline: Extreme envelope (non-doctrinal)
text.text: Upper-bound exploratory envelope. Not asserted; shown as an extreme plausibility band.
